<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Book of Lingering Blaze](/Equipment.aspx?ID=990)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Grimoire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=387" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 162 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Remove the word "evocation" from the book of lingering blaze._

**Price** 900 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The common saying, “Where there is progress in the field of magic, there is always someone who uses it to set things on fire,” is engraved in gold on the cover of this red spellbook.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> envision ([metamagic](/Traits.aspx?ID=107))    **Effect** If your next action is to cast an evocation spell dealing [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) damage that you prepared from this grimoire, you superheat the flames, allowing the spell to ignore up to 10 resistance to fire of creatures affected by the spell.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
